title: Scaffold Project Structure & Environment (NiceGUI)
description: Initialize the project directory. 1. Create `requirements.txt` with `nicegui`, `networkx`, `graphviz`, `pytest`. 2. Create a basic `app.py` that imports nicegui and prints `PRISM System Online`.
completion_promise: pip install -r requirements.txt && python -c "import nicegui; import networkx; import graphviz; assert True"

title: Implement User-Partitioned Data Schema
description: Create `src/data_manager.py`. Implement `DataManager` class to load/save `data/{user}.json`. ALSO CREATE `tests/test_data_manager.py` to verify it.
context: See Section 3.1 of document.md. Schema must include `user_id`, `applied_mutations` (list), and `nodes` (list).

title: Implement Mutation Ledger System
description: Create `src/mutation_manager.py`. Logic to write/read mutations in `mutations/`. ALSO CREATE `tests/test_mutations.py` to verify applying mutations (Create/Update/Delete) to the data state.

title: Develop RGB Graph Renderer (ECharts)
description: Update `src/graph_viz.py`. Implement `GraphVisualizer` with NetworkX to generate ECharts configuration compatible with NiceGUI. Update `tests/test_graph_viz.py` to verify ECharts output format.
context: See Section 2 `Core Visual Logic` and Section 6 `Implementation Stack`.

title: Implement Floating Context Window Logic (NiceGUI)
description: Update `src/ui_components.py` with functions to generate UI state for NiceGUI. Update `tests/test_ui_struct.py`.

title: Implement Drill Down Logic (Backlog & Tri-State)
description: Create `src/drill_engine.py`. Implement the Backlog/Tri-State voting logic. Create `tests/test_drill_logic.py` to verify state transitions (Accepted/Rejected/Ignored).

title: Git Automation Hooks
description: Create `src/git_manager.py`. Implement `GitManager` class. Create `tests/test_git_manager.py` that mocks subprocess calls to verify correct git commands are issued.

title: Integrate Main Application Logic (NiceGUI)
description: Refactor `app.py` to use NiceGUI. Integrate `DataManager` and `DrillEngine`. Use `ui.echart` for visualization and `ui.card`/`ui.row` for interactions.
completion_promise: python -c "import os; assert os.path.exists('app.py') and os.path.getsize('app.py') > 100"
